txt.en: 'Oh my, is that lamb? I love lamb!'
'Yes it is, slaughtered fresh this afternoon.'
'Then I just have to have some. Wrap up four pounds for me, and I'll come by and pick it up later.'
'How's the party?'
'Oh it's a good one all right! Almost as good as the party over in Hobbiton a few years back.'
'Is that so?'
'Is is so, save of course for a decent set of fireworks. Where do you suppose we could get some of those?'
'Come on now, you know I've been saving those for a special occasion! They were a gift.'
'How special does the occasion need to be? You're not likely to make it to eleventy-one years old!'
'How's business been today?'
'What I do with them's my business and don't let me catch you or your boys eyeing them neither!'
'Like most days, business is fair. Have you been to the party at the tent? Sounds like it's a good time.'
'Not yet, I'll most likely head over there now. Have a good day!'
'Be sure to have a drink for me. I'll try to catch up later.'
'I think I'll do just that very thing!'
'How are the festivities?'
'What's that?
'The party, how is the party?'
'Best we've had in a while, and boy do we need it!'
'That we have! How's the music?'
'Old Hal's outdoing himself tonight! You'd think he was sixty again!'
'I see Rose is here too, what a good couple they make.'
'That they do.'
'Hey, how's business been today?'
Fisherman
